subject: Critical Thinking
title: How to Argue Without Fallacies
description: A quick, practical guide to How to Argue Without Fallacies.

hook.text: Knowing 100 fallacies is useless if you can't construct a sound argument yourself. Offense matters, not just defense.

buildup.text: Step 1: State your claim clearly. Step 2: Provide relevant evidence. Step 3: Show how the evidence supports the claim.

discovery.text: The strongest move: acknowledge counterarguments before the opponent raises them, then explain why your position.

twist.text: Admitting uncertainty is a strength, not a weakness.

climax.text: The goal isn't to win â€” it's to find truth together. Arguments are collaborative truth-seeking, not verbal combat.

punchline.text: The best argument is one you'd accept if someone else made it.

quiz.question: What is the strongest rhetorical move in an argument?
options: Acknowledging counterarguments before the opponent raises them
Using as many facts as possible
